title: Create VS Code Extension for Horizon Tools
description: Create a new VS Code extension package in the Horizon monorepo that registers language model tools for Copilot, directly integrating Horizon's core library to manage tasks without CLI or MCP. This enables seamless task management in VS Code chats, using InversifyJS for DI and storing data in .horizon/issues.jsonl.
notes: Completed all subtasks: package structure, tool definitions, implementation, and build/package. VS Code extension now registers Horizon tools for Copilot without CLI or MCP.

title: Set up VS Code extension package structure
description: Create packages/vscode-extension directory with package.json and tsconfig.json, and update root package.json workspaces.
notes: Created packages/vscode-extension with package.json, tsconfig.json, and basic extension.ts. Updated root workspaces automatically via packages/*.

title: Define language model tools in extension package.json
description: Add contributes.languageModelTools to package.json for Horizon commands like create, list, update.
notes: Added languageModelTools for horizon_create, horizon_list_ready, horizon_update, horizon_dep_add with appropriate input schemas.

title: Implement extension.ts for tool registration
description: Write extension.ts to register tools, initialize Horizon container, and invoke core services.
notes: Implemented extension.ts with tool registration using vscode.lm.registerTool, integrated Horizon core services, added error handling.

title: Build, test, and package the extension
description: Set up build process, test in VS Code Extension Host, and create .vsix package.
notes: Built the extension successfully. Added packaging script with @vscode/vsce. Packaging includes core dependencies as expected for monorepo setup. Manual testing in VS Code Extension Host recommended.

title: Add Command Palette Command for Task List UI View
description: Implement a VS Code command palette command that opens a tabbed UI view listing Horizon tasks. The task list should update in real-time as tasks are modified.
